category.title: Climate related forcing
category.description: Forcing data describing physical or chemical systems, in particular the climate, the oceans, and the cryosphere.

category.title: Static geographic information
category.description: Geographic or other time-independent information, such as land-sea masks, or river routing networks.

category.title: Direct human forcing
category.description: Independent additional forcing data, which influence climate impacts, such as land-use, population or economic changes.

variable.long_name: Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation
variable.comment: Value between 0 and 100. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If lai is static, the timestep specifier "fixed" can be used.

The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their PFT definitions. This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc. Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid cell that is land. For models that have grid cells partially covered by land and ocean, please document this in the model documentation and provide your land-sea mask along the data uploads.
The canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Gross Primary Production on Land
variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Autotrophic (plant) Respiration on Land
variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Primary Production on Land
variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land
variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to C Emission from Fire
variable.comment: Total C emitted from all fires (including deforestation and peat fire C emission).

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Production on Land
variable.comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes from fire, harvest, grazing and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Land Use Change
variable.comment: For wood products only. Sum of carbon fluxes to wood production and wood storage turnover emissions from previous years.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Grazing
variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Crop Harvesting
variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation to Litter
variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Litter to Soil
variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Litter to Soil in each layer
variable.comment: If possible, provide carbon fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, only provide “flittersoil-total. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

variable.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
variable.comment: Carbon going  directly into the soil pool without entering litter (e.g., root exudate). Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil in each layer
variable.comment: If possible, provide carbon fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, only provide “fvegsoil-total. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
As kg carbon m⁻² s⁻¹

variable.long_name: Grid averaged methane emissions from wetland
variable.comment: Net upward flux of methane from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

variable.long_name: Total Surface Carbon Mass Flux into CH4 emissions
variable.comment: If possible, provide CH₄ emissions for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

variable.frequency: monthly, else annual (or fixed if static)
variable.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by wetland. Report only one year if  fixed percentage is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Soil Respiration on Land of pools with different turnover time in each layer
variable.comment: If possible, provide soil respiration for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. If you do not report layers, the depth dimension is 1. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, the variable can additionally be provided separated by pools (see note below the table).

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Soil Respiration on Land
variable.comment: Grid cell total.

variable.long_name: Vertical Carbon Mass Flux between layers
variable.comment: If possible, provide net changes due to vertical fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Litter Respiration on Land in each layer
variable.comment: If possible, provide net changes due to vertical fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land in each layer
variable.comment: If possible, provide heterotrophic respiration for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide heterotrophic respiration integrated over the entire soil depth. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Bioenergy Harvesting
variable.comment: Refers to secondary bioenergy crops and should not be included in fcropharvest-total. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment.permafrost: Grid cell total, PFT information if possible.

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻². Stand total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Above Ground Litter Pool

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.fire: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: Species information is essential. Stand total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total, PFT information if possible.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Below Ground Litter Pool
variable.comment: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. If not, only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

variable.long_name: Total Carbon Mass in both Above and Below Ground Litter Pool
variable.comment: Sum of below and above ground carbon in litter pools. Not required if `clitterag` and `clitterbg` are provided. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. The comments for `clitterag` and `clitterbg` apply.

Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and species information is essential.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool in each layer

comment.biomes: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.fire: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.forestry: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and species information is essential. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.peat: Soil carbon excluding below-ground litter if your model reports clitterag or clitterbg. If your model does not reports clitterag or clitterbg, report soil carbon including below-ground litter as csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, the variable can additionally be provided separated by pools (see note below the table).
comment.permafrost: Soil carbon excluding below-ground litter if your model reports clitterag or clitterbg. If your model does not reports clitterag or clitterbg, report soil carbon including below-ground litter as csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, the variable can additionally be provided separated by pools (see note below the table).

variable.long_name: Carbon in Products of Land Use Change
variable.comment: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation.
Including sapwood and hardwood.
Including fine and coarse roots.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
Number of Deaths Attributable to Cold
variable.comment: For ERF models, this occurs when temperature is below threshold (e.g., minimum mortality temperature (MMT)). Report 0 if temperature above threshold. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

variable.long_name: Number of Deaths Attributable to Heat
variable.comment: Temperature above threshold (ERFs). Report 0 if temperature below threshold. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

To be reported as annual series of mean daily total mortality, or as a single number of mean daily mortality; to be used for computations of attributable fractions. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.
Baseline population data should be provided for computations of mortality rates (i.e. deaths per total population). See Section ‎5.1.6. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.
100 highest trees per hectare.
For models including natural regeneration this variable may not make sense, please report domhei.
Mean height of the 100 highest trees per hectare.
DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species

variable.long_name: Remaining Stem Number after Disturbance and Management by DBH-Class
variable.comment: DBH-Class Resolution: Either DBH-Classes or Total per Species
DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species
Weighted by basal area to avoid over-representation of small trees

variable.long_name: Removed Stem Numbers by DBH-Class by Natural Mortality
variable.comment: As trees per hectare. DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species

variable.long_name: Removed Stem Numbers by DBH-Class by Management
variable.comment: As trees per hectare. DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species
Yield may be identical to above-ground biomass (biom) if the entire plant is harvested, e.g. for bioenergy production.
Evapotranspiration = sum of transpiration, evaporation, interception and sublimation aggregated across the growing season.

Integral of the total nitrogen application rate over the growing season. If organic and inorganic amendments are applied, the nitrogen application should be reported as effective inorganic nitrogen input (ignoring residues).

As Julian dates. The planting date reported here corresponds to the actual planting date in the simulation and may differ from the prescribed crop calendar planting date in rare cases as certain models may delay prescribed planting for a few days to have more suitable soil moisture and temperature conditions.
Together with the day and year of planting it allows for clear identification of anthesis.
Together with the day and year of planting it allows for clear identification of maturity.
Usually the year when maturity is reached. Can also be computed from planting and maturuty day.

Albedo of the land surface interacting with the atmosphere. Average of pfts, snow cover, bare ground.
Total area percentage of grid cell that has burned at any time (including peat and deforestation fires).

variable.long_name: Burnt Area Fraction from Fire Mediated Land-Cover Change
variable.comment: Area percentage of grid cell that has burned from deforestation fires (if simulated). Should be part of burntarea-total.

variable.long_name: Burnt Area Fraction from Peat Fire
variable.comment: Area percentage of grid cell that has burned from peatland fires (if simulated). Should be part of burntarea-total.
C emitted from peat fires (if simulated). Should also be part of ffire.

variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Fire Mediated Land-Cover Change
variable.comment: C emitted from deforestation fires (if simulated). Should be part of ffire.
If calculated, weighted by burned area. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
Model-specific fuel classes stored in the `classes` attribute of the `fuelclass` dimension.

variable.long_name: Combustion Completeness of Different Fuel Classes
variable.comment: (between 0 and 1), fraction of fuel combusted in a fire. Model-specific fuel classes stored in the `classes` attribute of the `fuelclass` dimension.

variable.long_name: Fuel Moisture for Different Fuel Classes
variable.comment: As a fraction of fuel dry mass (not percentage). Model-specific fuel classes stored in the `classes` attribute of the `fuelclass` dimension.
95th percentile of number of fires in one day during the month
Fraction of area covered by trees
Monthly mean weighted with the number of fires of each day
95th percentile of fire size computed during the month
Mean needs to be weighted with the number of fires

variable.long_name: Weighted Mean Fire Rate of Spread
variable.comment: Mean needs to be weighted with burned area
Mean height of canopy formed by trees over 5m.  Vegetation of less than 5m should be excluded from the canopy height calculation (i.e. not contributing with zero)
Fraction of grid cell covered with vegetation less than 5 m tall
Fraction of grid cell covered with vegetation more than 5 m tall

Grid fraction covered by the natural, drained, restored or mineral (i.e. not peat) peat types. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). Report only one year if fixed percentage is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.

Thickness of peat layer. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). Report only one year if fixed depth is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.

Hydraulic conductivity at saturation. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

Volumetric fraction of pore space in soil. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

Water table level relative to the ground surface. Note that a negative value should depict a water table below the soil surface. If the model works with subgrid topographic variation (microtopography approach in peatlands), the reference soil surface for **wt** is represented by the mean elevation of the soil surface. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table).

variable.long_name: Volumetric soil moisture contents at -5 hPa
variable.comment: Volumetric soil moisture. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

variable.long_name: Volumetric soil moisture contents at -15 hPa

variable.long_name: Volumetric soil moisture contents at -50 hPa

If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

variable.long_name: Volumetric soil moisture contents at -330 hPa

If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
Grid fraction that is flooded, i.e. where the water table is above ground surface. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table).
Depth of drainage of artificial drainage network. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table).
Density of drainage network as total length of drainage network per km². Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table).

Age of soil carbon. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
Total (surface + subsurface) runoff (qtot = qs + qsb). Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.
Water that leaves the surface layer (top soil layer) e.g. as overland flow / fast runoff.
Sum of water that flows out from subsurface layer(s) including the groundwater layer (if present). Equals qg in case of a groundwater layer below only one soil layer.

For models that consider both diffuse and focussed/localised recharge this should be the sum of both; other models should submit the groundwater recharge component that the model simulates. See also the descriptions in qrf and qrd.
Water that directly flows from a surface water body into the groundwater layer below. Only submit if the model separates focussed/localised recharge from diffuse recharge.

comment.groundwater: Downwards flux from soil to groundwater (entering aquifer= positive value). Unit is equal to mm s-1.
comment.water_global: Groundwater recharge from water that enters the groundwater layer via percolation through the soil. Only submit if the model separates focussed/localised recharge from diffuse recharge. For models that do not simulate groundwater this can be seepage instead of recharge.

variable.comment: Water that leaves the groundwater layer. In case seepage is simulated but no groundwater layer is present, report seepage as qr and qg.
River discharge or streamflow. Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.
Sum of transpiration, evaporation, interception and sublimation.
As evap, but with all resistances set to zero, except the aerodynamic resistance.

Please provide soil moisture for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

Please provide soil moisture for all depth levels and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

Temperature of each soil layer. Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea". If daily resolution not possible, please provide monthly. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

harmonization.title: Default
harmonization.description: Model should use their individual “best representation” of the historical period with regard to sowing dates, harvesting dates, fertilizer application rates and crop varieties.

harmonization.title: Fully harmonized
harmonization.description: Simulations based on prescribed “present day” fertilization rates (available for download) and fixed planting and harvesting dates (also available for download). Modelers should have planting as closely as possible to these dates, but it may be admissible to use these dates as indicators for planting windows (depending on model specifics).

harmonization.title: Harmonized seasons with no N constraints
harmonization.description: For models with an explicit description of the nitrogen cycle: harmnon simulations should be run with nitrogen stress turned off completely or (if that’s not possible) with very high N application rates to make model results comparable between those GGCMs that have explicit N dynamics and those that do not. For models without the nitrogen cycle: harmnon and fullharm simulations are the same and do not need to be duplicated. Please contact the sector coordination to push on with this side branch.

product.title: Input Data
product.description: The data used to drive the impact models, exactly as described in the ISIMIP simulation protocol.

product.title: Secondary Input Data
product.description: Data that have been derived from or are related to the input data, but not described in the simulation protocol (e.g. with a different spatial or temporal resolution).

product.title: Output Data
product.description: The climate-impacts simulation data provided by participating modelling groups, corresponding to the output variables described in the ISIMIP simulation protocol.

product.title: Secondary Output Data
product.description: Data that have been derived by processing the ISIMIP output data, but do not correspond to output variables described in the simulation protocol.

upstream_variable.comment: The biophysical forcing data consists of the crop yield data provided by a subset of crop models, including: DSSAT-Pythia, EPIC-IIASA, LPJmL, PEPIC, pDSSAT, and GEPIC. Only crop yields  and not crop production, at GADM administrative level-2, are required. The gridded crop yield data will be aggregated to the sub-national level. Only the 2015soc and 2015soc-from-histsoc runs will be used.
Please use one or several ISIMIP3a global water model(s), but not a multi-model mean.
Please use one or several ISIMIP3a global water model(s), but not a multi-model mean.
Please use one or several ISIMIP3a global water model(s), but not a multi-model mean.

soc_scenario.description: Varying direct human influences in the historical period.
soc_scenario.description_note: Please label your model run `histsoc` **even if** it only partly accounts for varying direct human forcings while another part of the the direct human forcing is considered constant or is ignored.

soc_scenario.description: Fixed year-1901 direct human influences (e.g. land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort).
soc_scenario.description_note: Please only label your model run `1901soc` if it does not at all account for historical changes in direct human forcing, but they do represent constant year-1901 levels of direct human forcing for at least some direct human forcings. This scenario may be thought of an approximation of pre-industrial levels of human impacts.

soc_scenario.description: Fixed year-2015 direct human influences (e.g. land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort).
soc_scenario.description_note: Please label your simulations `2015soc` if they do not at all account for historical changes in direct human forcing, but they do represent constant year-2015 levels of direct human forcing for at least some direct human forcings.

Please only label your model run `nat` if it does not at all account for any direct human forcings, including e.g. human land use or fishing. For Nitrogen deposition please use the prepared files (with the values for 1850) or specify which other preindustrial value you used in the model documentation.

bias_adjustment.description: Refers to W5E5 data used for the bias-correction globally on a 0.5° grid.
Indicates that no bias correction was performed on the climate data (e.g. ocean data).

geo_dataset.comment: Input dataset documentation → [Land-sea mask](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/41/). Same as **landseamask** but without Antarctica.

Input dataset documentation → [Land-sea mask](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/41/). This is the generic land-sea mask from ISIMIP2b that is to be used for global water simulations in ISIMIP3. It marks more grid cells as land than **landseamask**. Over those additional land cells, the climate data that are based on W5E5 (GSWP3-W5E5 as well as climate data bias-adjusted using W5E5) are not guaranteed to represent climate conditions over land. Instead they may represent climate conditions over sea or a mix of conditions over land and sea.
Country masks from the ISIpedia project. More formats are available at <https://github.com/ISI-MIP/isipedia-countries>.
Fractional country masks from the ISIpedia project. More formats are available at <https://github.com/ISI-MIP/isipedia-countries>.
Database of Global Administrative Areas (GADM) at administrative levels 0,1 and 2 (Version 4.1, 16 July 2022). More formats are available at <https://gadm.org/data.html>.

sens_scenario.description: For all experiments other than the sensitivity experiments.
CO₂ concentration fixed at 1901 levels as a deviation from the `obsclim` climate + CO₂ forcing.
Observation-based CO₂ concentration (as in `obsclim`) used with `counterclim` atmospheric forcing.
No water management (e.g. no human water abstraction, no reservoirs) while other direct human forcings such as land use changes are considered according to `histsoc` or `2015soc`.

Fixed year-1901 irrigation areas and water use efficiencies but representation of other direct human influences such as land use changes according to `histsoc`. This experiment is related to the IRRMIP initiative.
Simulation with fire switched off to identify impact of fire within the model.
For fisheries and marine ecosystems sector. JRA55 driven GFDL-MOM6-COBALT2 ocean climate with constant riverine nutrient and freshwater influx.
sens_scenario.description_note: Climate forcing to be taken from the `ctrlclim` inputs.

sens_scenario.description: For fisheries and marine ecosystems sector combining JRA55 driven GFDL-MOM6-COBALT2 ocean climate with constant riverine nutrient and freshwater influx `1955-riverine-input` with the `60arcmin` spatial resolution.
Observed climate forcing using `30arcsec` resolution used for sensitivity runs to determine the best spatial resolution of climate input data for impact models.
Observed climate forcing using `90arcsec` resolution used for sensitivity runs to determine the best spatial resolution of climate input data for impact models.
Observed climate forcing using `300arcsec` resolution used for sensitivity runs to determine the best spatial resolution of climate input data for impact models.
Observed climate forcing using `1800arcsec` resolution used for sensitivity runs to determine the best spatial resolution of climate input data for impact models.
For fisheries and marine ecosystems sectors. Low resolution sensitivity experiment. JRA55 driven GFDL-MOM6-COBALT2 ocean climate on one degree spatial resolution.

Please note that the deciduous admixtures only appear in the data at a later stage and hence do not need to be simulated. Only simulate pine and spruce (no hard-woods) and regenerate as pure pine stand

forcing_data.title: Counterfactual "no-climate change" atmospheric climate forcing
forcing_data.comment: Input dataset documentation → [GSWP3-W5E5](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/110/), [20CRv3](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/106/), [20CRv3-W5E5](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/104/), [20CRv3-ERA5](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/105/).

forcing_data.title: Local atmospheric climate forcing for lake locations
forcing_data.comment: Extractions of grid cell data from global atmospheric climate forcing. See list of lakes sites [here](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/isimip3-local-lake-sites/).

forcing_data.title: Tropical cyclone tracks and windfields
forcing_data.comment: We do not provide "no climate change" TC tracks and windfields but the original tracks from the IBTrACS database ([Knapp et al. 2010](https://doi.org/10.1175/2009BAMS2755.1)) (period 1841-2021) windfields calculated by Holland model ([Holland 1980](https://doi.org/10.1175/1520-0493(1980)108%3C1212:AAMOTW%3E2.0.CO;2), [Holland 2008](https://doi.org/10.1175/2008MWR2395.1)) should be used in combination with the counterfactual water levels to estimate the impacts of sea level rise on TC induced damages, losses or replacement.

forcing_data.title: Lightning
forcing_data.comment: We do not provide "no climate change" lightning data. Instead the original Flash Rate Monthly Climatology from [Cecil (2006)](https://doi.org/10.5067/LIS/LIS-OTD/DATA303) should be used in the **counterclim** set-up.

forcing_data.title: Oceanic forcing data
forcing_data.comment: We do not provide any counterfactual oceanic forcings, i.e. there is no "no climate change" experiment proposed for the fisheries and marine ecosystems sector.

forcing_data.title: Coastal water levels
forcing_data.comment: Detrended version of the **obsclim** hourly coastal water levels. Input dataset documentation → [Coastal water levels](https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/181/).

forcing_data.title: Atmospheric CO₂ concentration
forcing_data.comment: We provide files containing a constant value of 296.13ppm for the CO₂ concentration (the historical value for 1901).

forcing_data.title: Atmospheric CH₄ concentration
forcing_data.comment: We provide files containing a constant value of 928.80 ppb for the CH₄ concentration (the historical value for 1901).
